Articles.Content: I'm currently using Wings 3D because thats modeling program that i know the best. I tried Blender but i don't really like it. And also im new to modding and i only made a couple of engines and tanks for now. Can i get some help for animation and making a new cockpit? I can't really find any tutorials online for this. I know that here there is a lot more expirienced modders so im asking for some help. Thanks in advance

So what do you need help with exactly?

if all else fails: http://www./download/my57w7lkxoqwsvy/VSR-MASTER.zip

That includes most of the parts in the stock game in a Unity file, functional and ready to go.

It's more than 1gb though.
I don't really know how to animate things in Wings 3D (Or is it even possible) or in Unity. I wanted to try and make some solar panels
Wings3D cannot animate. You'll need to use Unity. I don't see anything in the mod dev sticky so you'll need to look in the Unity help docs.
So i just animate in Unity? How do i make like joints where panels flex so i can animate them?

You don't need to set up 'joints' per say. What are you making? A solar panel? (in which case make sure you consult the various solar panel threads here)

For the sake of example, I'll run with the example of the solar panel. Set up the hierarchy so that the last panel is nested under the second to last, etc up to the first. So if you rotate the first panel, the others swing with it, down the line. It helps to offset the faces of the mesh from the transform node, so that the center of rotation for each object is at the edge of the panel / at the hinge.

I don't actually know how to use the animation tools in Unity (I just animate in Maya) so you'll have to figure that out somewhere else.
Thanks. I will try and do it as you said and ill make evry panel a seperate object so i cant parent them as you said

Yeah they'll need to each be a separate object. There are a lot of special rules for naming, orientation and hierarchy when dealing with solar panels so if that is what you're up to make sure to check the solar panel stuff in the thread I linked. You'll have to scroll down.
And just one more question. I want to coontiniue making mods and lots of other stuff for KSP so should i keep using Wigs3D or should i swithc to some else modeling program?

And just one more question. I want to coontiniue making mods and lots of other stuff for KSP so should i keep using Wigs3D or should i swithc to some else modeling program?

That's entirely up to you. Blender can be daunting but it's a good program that has a bigger toolbox than Wings. Personally I use Autodesk Maya for modeling and animating, and I use a plugin called Nightshade UV Editor to unwrap. I'm not sure what the restrictions on it are but you can get a student non-commercial license of Maya for free. Use whatever is comfortable to you, and don't be afraid to learn new programs. Each has it's own strengths and weaknesses, and you'll never have one program that excels at everything.
